ngiemboon: Pakẅé ncùb pà Loma pâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńkʉ́e wɔ́b, é ne ńtóo metsèm, á lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô léjúʼu nò yé.
en: All   the tax collectors  # 15:1 Mt 11:19; Lk 5:29 and sinners were approaching to listen to him.

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè pâ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê gyá púʼu, é zẅɛte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ wɛ̂ ne ńkúe pʉ̀a tepòŋ tà pâ pɔ̌ téme shúm ńjÿó!»
en: And the Pharisees and scribes were complaining, “This man welcomes sinners   and eats with them.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké saga mbwó pɔ́b ngie:
en: So he told them this parable:

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ gẅi lɔɔn ńgẅiin menjʉ̀njÿò nkÿo, ńgʉa tsẅɛ lépféle, tàʼ pyé, mbà à ge gǎa? Mbà à te nyé yetsɔ́ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ lé móm lepfwɔʼɔ́, é gʉa faʼ gie e pyě tà gyá wɔ́ɔ?
en: “What man among you, who has a hundred sheep and loses one of them,    does not leave the ninety-nine in the open field   # 15:4 Or the wilderness and go after the lost one until he finds it?

ngiemboon: À ge faʼ tà gyá, é pú kág, é kaa zába mekẅí yé,
en: When he has found it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders,

ngiemboon: é lɔg piŋ tà kúu mbʉ̀a, é tóŋ meshǔ pé mbɔɔ ngàŋ nkwɔʼɔ́ mbʉ̀a, é gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: “Pege kág, ńtí páʼ n gyǎ njʉ̀njÿò yɔ̀ɔn gie e ka pyě.”
en: and coming home, he calls his friends and neighbors together, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my lost sheep! ’

ngiemboon: Áa púʼu, tá mèŋ n ge shwóŋo gẅí ngie tàʼ ngàŋ mefʉa wémɔʼɔ́ zɔ lɔɔn ńkúbe mà we, mbà lekág ge gwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó tɛʼ, é cʉa páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé kág ńtí pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ né móm lepfwɔʼɔ́ pie é ne ńgÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńzɛ́te tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pɔ́ le gíŋ ńkúbe mà wɔb wɔ́.
en: I tell you, in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven    over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who don’t need repentance.

ngiemboon: Pi gíŋ ńjúʼu tsɔ́, manzwě lɔɔn ńgẅiin nkáb ye pàg legém, tàʼa pàg pyé, mbà à ge gǎa? Mbà à te lyɛɛ lâm, é jÿɔg ndá, é taʼ kʉ̀ŋe, é pʉ́le faʼ tà láʼ gyá wáa?
en: “Or what woman who has ten silver coins,   ,# 15:8 A Gk drachma was equivalent to a Roman denarius = one day’s wage if she loses one coin, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search carefully until she finds it?

ngiemboon: À ge gyá, é tóŋ meshǔ pé mbɔɔ ngàŋ nkwɔʼɔ́ mbʉ̀a, é gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: “Pi tó pege kág ńtí páʼ n gyǎ pàga nkáb yɔ́ɔn gie á ka pyě.”
en: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found the silver coin I lost! ’

ngiemboon: Áa púʼu, tá mèŋ n ge shwóŋo gẅí ngie mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé kág, ńtí tàʼ nyìŋ tepòŋ wémɔʼɔ́ gẅie à kubé mà we.»
en: I tell you, in the same way, there is joy in the presence of God’s angels    over one sinner who repents.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa lǎʼ ńgẅiin gubé yé yembàŋa yépʉ́a.
en: He also said, “A man had two sons.

ngiemboon: We nkʉ́ néŋe tà ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: “Tɔ̌ɔnmé, gʉa na shúm ségè, ńná wɔ́ɔn tÿɔgɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.” Tá we fó ńdɔg shúm sé ńgaba wɔ́b mépʉ́a,
en: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate I have coming to me.’ So he distributed the assets    to them.

ngiemboon: é gwaa cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ shÿɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, múɔ ŋwɛ́ sẅiŋ sé shúm, ńdɔg nkáb ńgʉa lé túm, ńkúu zɔgɔ́ tepòŋ, ḿbú ńcʉŋte nkáb ya,
en: Not many days later, the younger son gathered together all he had and traveled to a distant country, where he squandered    his estate in foolish living.   # 15:13 Rm 6:2; 8:12; Gl 2:14; Col 3:7

ngiemboon: ńcʉŋte nkáb tà é gwaa mag, gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ. Á zye lézága ye mpfɛ̌.
en: After he had spent everything, a severe famine struck that country, and he had nothing.

ngiemboon: Ńtebe tà ńgʉa ńkúu fàʼ mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ we láʼ ŋwɛ́. Á túmo yé nkáʼ lépyɛ́b mekúnɔ̀ɔn.
en: Then he went to work for one of the citizens of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ, ńzága mmó gie à ge pfɛ́, nzyè pú ńgyáŋa yé, tà á tsɔ́ɔn shúm léjÿó mekúnɔ̀ɔn, tá nyìŋ te tsoon fùbe na shúm léjÿó mekúnɔ̀ɔn né yé ná.
en: He longed to eat his fill from    the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one would give him anything.

ngiemboon: Á néŋe tà ńkwaŋte ntʉ́m yé ngie: “Megàŋafàʼ tá wɔ̀ɔn ée mbʉ̀a ńjÿó shúm tà ńgwáʼa tsɔ́, n gwɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn ńkwé nzyè lá!
en: When he came to his senses,    he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have more than enough food, and here I am dying of hunger!   # 15:17 Or dying in the famine; v. 14

ngiemboon: N ge fó jʉʼɔɔn gʉa, é piŋ nzèm lé mbʉ̀a tá wɔ̀ɔn, é tó gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, n ka gÿo nò tepòŋ mbwó Ssé, mbɔɔ mbwó gù.
en: I’ll get up, go to my father, and say to him, “Father, I have sinned    against heaven   # 15:18 Mt 21:25; Jn 3:27 and in your sight.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, n te gíŋ ńkuʼu gẅie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ́ɔn lê míŋ gù wɔ́. Fó ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńgÿo tsɔ̌ ngàŋafàʼ ɔ̀ la.”
en: I’m no longer worthy    to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired workers.” ’

ngiemboon: Ńkwaŋ púʼu, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńne ḿbiŋe né mbʉ̀a pɔ́b. Tá we tyé ńgyá yé, tà á nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, mezìŋe mé kúu yé, á nɔ́ɔnte yé, éfaŋte, ńcwoŋo ésiŋte yé.
en: So he got up and went to his father. But while the son was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion.    He ran, threw his arms around his neck, and kissed   # 15:20 Gn 29:13; 33:4; 45:15; 2Sm 14:33 him.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gɔɔn né tá we ngie: “Tɔ̌ɔnmé, n ka gÿo nò tepòŋ mbwó Ssé, mbɔɔ mbwó gù, n te gíŋ ńkuʼu gẅie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ́ɔn lê míŋ gù wɔ́.”
en: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight. I’m no longer worthy to be called your son.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, tá we gɔɔn né megàŋafàʼ ngie: “Pi lwo ńgʉa faʼ nzsǒ mbòŋo ńdɔg ńtó ḿmaʼa na yé, ńdíe kwáŋ shÿɔ́gɔ na múɔ tepwó we, éfaʼ melɔ̌ɔn shÿɔ́gɔ mekwò yé.
en: “But the father told his servants, ‘Quick! Bring out the best robe    and put it on him; put a ring   # 15:22 Gn 41:42; Est 3:10; 8:2 on his finger and sandals   # 15:22 Ezk 16:10 on his feet.

ngiemboon: Pi faʼa múɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛʼ la, ńzẅé pege pfɛ́, ńkág,
en: Then bring the fattened calf    and slaughter it, and let’s celebrate with a feast,

ngiemboon: ńtí páʼ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn wɔɔn à ka kwě, à zǐm, à ka pyě, n gíŋ ńgyá yé.” Ńgɔɔn púʼu, pɔ́ zye línɔ̀ɔn.
en: because this son of mine was dead and is alive again;    he was lost and is found! ’ So they began to celebrate.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, míŋ we welÿò gwɔ́ nkáʼ, ńgÿo ne ḿbiŋe, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ lékúu mbʉ̀a, ńjúʼ mé gwɔ́ wó ńzɔbɔ ńzíŋe.
en: “Now his older son was in the field; as he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.

ngiemboon: Á tóŋo tsɔ̌ ngàŋafàʼ, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Akɔ́ áa mbʉ̀a?
en: So he summoned one of the servants, questioning what these things meant.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋafàʼ gɔɔn ngie: “Mémá gù zɔ cʉ̌ʼ ńtó tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, tá gù zẅě múɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛʼ la, mé ne ńdɔgɔ ńkága.”
en: ‘Your brother is here,’ he told him, ‘and your father has slaughtered the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.’

ngiemboon: Andyè we júʼ púʼu, ḿbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ tà ńdʉʼʉ lékúu ndá. Tá we kẅɛɛ pǐ ḿbúʼ mbwó mbwó yé ngie à kúu ndá.
en: “Then he became angry and didn’t want to go in. So his father came out and pleaded with him.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: “Tɔ̌ɔn, mèŋ faʼá mbwó gù ngùʼ shÿɔ́ʼɔ? N dǎ ké fʉa lepʉ̌ shú ka? Tà ɔ̀ lǎ fó ńnáa wɔ̀ɔn múɔ mvfóntʉ̀ ndàʼ ngie peg lâ meshǔ pɔ́ɔn zẅé ńdɔg ńkág?
en: But he replied to his father, ‘Look, I have been slaving many years for you, and I have never disobeyed your orders, yet you never gave me a goat so that I could celebrate with my friends.

ngiemboon: Míŋ gù gẅie pâ pakáatÿǒ panzwě kéen ḿpfɛ́ nkáb jù, à lěen ńtó, ɔ̀ gwóon ńzẅé múɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛʼ ńtí yé!”
en: But when this son of yours came, who has devoured your assets    with prostitutes,   # 15:30 Pr 29:3 you slaughtered the fattened calf for him.’

ngiemboon: Tá we gɔɔn ngie: “Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, pɔ̀gɔ zɔɔ ńzɔ́gɔ. Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie n gẅiin wɔ́ɔ, áa jú.
en: “ ‘Son,’    he said to him, ‘you are always with me,   # 15:31 Jn 8:35 and everything I have is yours.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á kɔʼɔ́ ḿboŋ ngie pege gÿo línɔ̀ɔn ńkág kwàʼ mboŋó, mélàʼmie afɛ̌ gù wɔɔn à ka kwě, à zimé na legwé, à kà pyě, n gǐŋ ńgyá yé.”»
en: But we had to celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ ”
